page.title: 16LITTLE BRITAIN
page.content: Little Britain Lake is very important as a centre for educational and leisure interests.Schools in the area visit the lake when they use the Little Britain Nature Trail.Originally a shallow gravel pit,the lake and its surrounding area has been turned into a mini nature reserve.Many different species of water fowl can been seen there as well as various different species of fish - the lake is a young anglers paradise.Insects,wild flowers and trees are plentiful and can also be studied.The water here and at the ford is shallow enough for paddling and safe swimming,the ideal spot for a week-end family picnic.Local horse riders frequently use the bridle path.It is a good spot for the amateur photographer.
